name: Savoy Boutique Hotel

reviews.text: The hotel is brand new and the staff is trained well. Big rooms with robes and free minibar. If you want something, the hotel easily gets it for you. Breakfast was fine. One thing though, when you shower the water runs everywhere BUT in the tub... Have towels ready!
reviews.title: Perfect! :)

reviews.text: This is a really lovely hotel. Rooms have plenty of character in an old style and are spotlessly clean and very comfortable. As you are literally right in the middle of the Old Town, it can be a bit noisy in the squares outside (at the weekend especially) but the rooms have double glazing which blocks most of it out. Maybe ear plugs required for the very light sleepers amongst you. The location far outweighs this though. Very close to all the main sites in the Old Town and staff are very friendly and helpful in providing information on everything from your doorstep to further afield.
reviews.title: Little bit noisy but very nice & great location!

reviews.text: Great hotel, very nice decor. I found the staff were very friendly/helpful. The hotel is situated in the town centre which is very convenient but beware of the noise on Thurs/Fri/Sat nights. I had a room which overlooked the main square and it was buzzing till 3am! As this is an old building the sound insulation isn't great. Fortunately I had my earplugs so it wasn't too bad.
reviews.title: Great hotel, can be a little noisy though

reviews.text: This is a boutique hotel and it has a nice character (I much prefer it to the hiltons/marriots of this world). There were a couple of teething problems (like the shower) but in general I would highly recommend it.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel in great location
Savoy Tallin: not quite 5 stars
reviews.text: Savoy Boutique Hotel is a quite small, newly opened hotel - perfectly located in the Old Town of Tallinn. I stayed here in October 2006 and I absolutely loved this hotel.

reviews.title: Exclusive - perfect location
reviews.text: Ok, the room could have been bigger, but it was beautifully decorated, and it had everything we needed. The beds were large and comfortable, and there was a work desk and a seating area. Amenities included high-speed cable & wireless internet connection (which was free of charge), a flatscreen tv, and a minibar. (Unusually, the contents of the minibar (Orange juice, coke, beer, water, chocolate) were free of charge.) We were also provided with thick fluffy bathrobes, and slippers. All rooms are non-smoking.

description: Sincere hospitality in an exclusive environment!* Superb location in Tallinn Old Town* A romantic, dignified and cozy boutique hotel* Amidst all cultural events and historic sights, built in 1890’s* Houses restaurant MEKK, which tempts you to discover Modern Estonian Cuisine. The Savoy Boutique Hotel is located at the very heart of Tallinn, in the medieval old town. It is a superb place for people who travel for business as well as for pleasure. The capital city's most noteworthy business, entertainment and shopping centers are nearby. The hotel building was constructed in 1890 and renovated in 2006. A piece of luxury that makes you feel at home.
